organizations.name: Alliance for Affordable Internet
quotes: The Alliance for Affordable Internet, for example, brings together companies, civil society organisations and governments to conduct research and policy advocacy on driving down the cost to connect and achieve universal, affordable internet access.

organizations.name: International Telecommunication Union (ITU)
quotes: The International Telecommunication Union (ITU) and the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) lead the Broadband Commission,

organizations.name: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)
quotes: The International Telecommunication Union (ITU) and the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) lead the Broadband Commission,

organizations.name: Broadband Commission
quotes: The International Telecommunication Union (ITU) and the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) lead the Broadband Commission,

organizations.name: United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF)
quotes: the United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF)’s Project Connect maps schools using satellite data and artificial intelligence,

organizations.name: World Bank
quotes: and the World Bank provides loans and grants for connectivity projects.

organizations.name: Loon
quotes: Loon, a project of Google’s parent company Alphabet, uses internet-enabled balloons – in the aftermath of Hurricane Maria, they provided connectivity to 200,000 in Puerto Rico.

organizations.name: Alphabet
quotes: Loon, a project of Google’s parent company Alphabet, uses internet-enabled balloons – in the aftermath of Hurricane Maria, they provided connectivity to 200,000 in Puerto Rico.

organizations.name: Amazon
quotes: Amazon, OneWeb, Telesat, Space Norway and SpaceX are among companies considering connectivity solutions using low-earth orbit satellites.

organizations.name: SpaceX
quotes: Amazon, OneWeb, Telesat, Space Norway and SpaceX are among companies considering connectivity solutions using low-earth orbit satellites.
Loon, a project of Google’s parent company Alphabet, uses internet-enabled balloons – in the aftermath of Hurricane Maria, they provided connectivity to 200,000 in Puerto Rico.
Some countries, such as Indonesia, have set targets that treat internet connectivity as a national priority.
